intro: Cephalaria gazipashensis subsp. gazipashensis, commonly known as the Gazipasha cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
